==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|大|一|ls=ic|t1=man|t2=hairpin}} – a man with a hairpin in his hair.

In ancient times, when men reached the age of 20, they bound their hair with a hairpin during the [[w:Guan Li|Guan Li ceremony]]. The hairpin is the sign of “a grownup man”.

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*p/ba||male, father, third-person pronoun}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|པ||''masculine noun suffix''}}, {{cog|my|ဖ||''masculine noun suffix''}}. Possibly related to {{och-l|父|father}}.

===Etymology 2===
“That”. {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} connects this with Proto-Loloish *''m-ba'' (“on the other side”), {{cog|bo|ཕ||beyond, farther on, onward}}. Maybe related to {{och-l|彼|that}}.
